intro: Oligolepis indicus, commonly known as the Indian thornapple, is a shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by follicles containing toxic seeds. It thrives in dry and semi-arid environments, often found in wastelands and along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
